title: Message preview stopped working
creator: chisel900
content: I am having a problem with my thunderbird email client. There was an update to the program over night and now when I load thunderbird it is unable to show me the content of emails in any of the folders. I can see the emails in the list and all the folders are shown in the folder tree on the left. Howevr I am not able to access the content of the emails. My thunderbird profile folder is on a network share, this fileserver is a windows based machine. If I copy the profile to my local machine the profile works correctly and I am able to open emails and view the contents. It is only when my profile is on the network that I cannot view the contents of the emails. I ran thunderbird in safe mode and this does not resolve the situation. I have tried to repair the folders but this did not work. I deleted the .msf files but this also did not work. I ran the thunderbird debugger and then tried to access an email, the debugger stopped on the follwing exception: NS_ERROR_XPC_BAD_CONVERT_JS: Could not convert JavaScript argument arg 0 [nsITreeView.setTree]. What could be the problem with my emails?

title: corpo email vuoto su finestra standalone quando apro .eml salvato su drive remoto
creator: giovanni.fantuzzi
content: Buongiorno a tutti. Windows 11 Version 24H2 Thunderbird 138.0.1 (64 bit) - nessuna estensione a parte componente "Provider per calendario google" - provato con "modalità risoluzione problemi" con esito negativo. Problema sorto dopo aggiornamento Windows del 14/05/2025, prima tutto ok: se trascino una email dall'applicazione ad una qualsiasi cartella del pc (in locale) oppure su una chiavetta usb, e poi faccio doppio click sul file.eml, si apre correttamente la form e si vede tutto (destinatari, oggetto, corpo del messaggio, allegati, ecc.); se invece trascino la medesima email su una qualsiasi cartella di un disco remoto in rete, e poi faccio doppio click sul file.eml, si apre una finestra "vuota" (vedi immagine allegata); se ri-trascino la mail "vuota" su una qualsiasi cartella del pc locale, si apre la form correttamente con tutto visibile. Ringrazio anticipatamente per qualsiasi suggerimento. -- Giovanni.
metadata: ;solver_id:6718871;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Thunderbird Headers taking too much space!
creator: SamSriLanka
content:
Headers are inconsequential, compared to the actual message content, I'm sure everybody will agree!

But on Thunderbird, recently, the headers take up almost HALF of the available space on the screen!

I have tried everything to reduce the message headers to ONE LINE (that is all it needs) but nothing works!!!

Have a look at FoxMail (screenshot below)! Compare it with how my Thunderbird looks (screenshot below)!

These are actual screenshots of what my entire screen looks like, with Thunderbird and FoxMail.

Foxmail has clean, simple, one line headers, with the message body taking up the maximum viewable space on the page! Thunderbird is almost 50% WASTED screen space!!!!

BTW the add-on / extension "Compact Headers" does not seem to work with the latest versions of Thunderbird.

Thank You!
metadata: ;solver_id:6718893;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Gmail and MS Exchange SMTP servers time out
creator: ioannis.roumeliotis
content: I am long time user of Thunderbird and currently using version 128.10. I am having trouble downloading and sending email either from Gmail or from my MS Exchange account as of late (May 2025). Email sometimes selectively downloads but I am no longer able to send email either through my Gmail of MS Exchange accounts as both the Gmail and exchange SMTP servers time out. This problem started with the previous versions of Thunderbird circa Nov/Dec 2024. A Thunderbird or Windows update resolves the problem for a short time but then the problem it reoccurs. Server settings are all correct and have been checked multiple times. I've deactivated Norton AV and firewalls, added and/or verified port exceptions but to no effect. This problems has resulted in many overlooked important emails until they've been double checked on webmail portal. Is trouble sending and receiving emails a broader issue with Thunderbird users and are Google and Microsoft deliberately making it difficult to use Thunderbird as an email client? I've seen older posts dating to 2023 reporting similar problems and I'm surprised that without changing anything on my end that this problem suddenly popped up. Any suggestions on how to resolve?

title: Sent folder empty
creator: jan.stempelmail
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for years. It connects to my gmail account using POP. I'm on a Windows computer using Windows 11 and Thunderbird says it's up to date with version 128.10.1esr.

For the past couple of weeks my Sent folder has been empty. Emails are sent successfully, they're just not stored.

I have searched for solutions but they all seem to deal with IMAP, not POP. I have found the folder (appdata\profiles etc) where the sent file exists, and it's there and very big. I tried copying it to a new name ("sent2") and asking Tbird to store sent messages there but it's still empty and not saving messages. I also tried deleting the sent.msf file and that didn't help either.

Any thoughts?

title: Export Thunderbird Contacts
creator: tzeller
content:
This questions is oft asked and answered, nonetheless, the answers include features I don't seem to have. Perhaps I am just not looking in the correct place.

I am told than once I am viewing the Address book, I can find "Export ..." and "Import ..." in the Tools menu (and that this is different from what one sees in when not viewing the Address book.

Not true for me. First, the Address book appears as a tab, just like and beside any open emails. Second there is no "Import ..." in Tools menu and the Export in that menu is the usual export of the entire profile, which includes the Address book in some form I am sure but not the form I need. See attached screenshot.

Seems I was able to do this in the past and the replies to others questions indicate it's still possible but try as I might, I can't find this feature.

If I am just being stupid, please be gentle in your response ...

Thanks, Tom Zeller

title: Printing an email has suddenly become slow
creator: jay46
content:
When I receive an email documenting an online purchase, it is my habit to print the page that tells the amount of the purchase and the vendor; I use the printed pages to keep my credit card up to date.

This has worked very well for many years. But now all of a sudden, sometimes Thunderbird imposes a rather long delay when preparing the "print preview" prior to printing the page. It's inconsistent; sometimes the page preview shows up instantly and sometimes it is a matter of many seconds. I have made no change to the printer or its connection (although Epson does from time to time issue updates to their drivers). No other application on my computer - not even Firefox - seems to suffer this delay; only Thunderbird.

This is with Thunderbird version 128.10.1esr, as well as with the previous 128.10.0esr

title: Cannot access emails in local folders after upgrade to 128.10.1esr, caused by UNC pathing (local folders are on network and accessible to 3 different computers)
creator: admin236
content:
Since upgrade to 128.10.1esr, list of emails in local folders is visible, but cannot view email contents, cannot forward, cannot reply, cannot move, cannot delete.

IMAP folder functionality is all OK.

Occurs in both 64 bit and 32 bit versions of 128.10.1esr

After this occurred on 64 bit machine, we had 32 bit two machines running a previous version of Thunderbird that were still able to access (read, forward, delete, etc) emails in the same local folders (local folders are on network and accessible to 3 different computers).

After upgrading one of them, access to emails on local folders broke on that one, but still working on remaining machine running older version.

This means it is not corruption of local folders (e.g. folder repair and .msf deletion don't make any difference).

It seems to be a problem with this version since update.

How can this be fixed, do we need to wait for another update?
